body.name: Phomemo Bluetooth Theraml Label Printer, 241BT 4X6 Wireless Shipping Label Printer for Samll Business, Pink Label Printer for Shipping Package, Compatible with iPhone, Android, Amazon, Shopify, UPSP
features: 【Print Wirelessly】 - Phomemo bluetooth shipping label printer supports wireless printing through bluetooth connection. For IOS and Android, need to download the "labelife " APP from Apple Store or Google Play. With easy and simple operations, you can easily print your documents, photos, and more, making your life more convenient! Note: All devices cannot be directly connected to Bluetooth and need to be used through the app.

【Print via USB Cable】 - For PC, Windows, Mac OS, Chrome OS, and Linux systems. For Chrome OS, need to enter “Labelife” in the Chrome web store and add the extension to your Google Chrome. (PC printing needs to download the driver: labelife.net/pm241) Note: PC only works with USB connection, you can not print via Bluetooth.

【Various Platforms Compatibility】 - This shipping label printer can support the width of 1 - 4.6 inches labels, which is widely used to print labels from major sales and shipping platforms, such as eBay, Shopify, Amazon, Etsy, Poshmark, UPS, USPS, FedEx, ShipStation, DHL, Shippo. One-click use: text, pictures, barcodes, QR codes, OCR, Form, Christmas Gift, Thanks cards, hundreds of icons, and many pre-made templates for commercial and home use. Improve your efficiency. Also a gift for your friends and family.

【Money and Time Saver】 -Phomemo label printer utilizes advanced thermal direct technology for printing, eliminating the need for expensive toner or ink. With a printing speed of 150 mm/s, the printer can produce up to 72 sheets of 4x6 labels per minute. Additionally, the 203 DPI resolution ensures that the printing is clear and precise. With this printer, you can save precious time and money, making it an ideal choice for your labeling needs.

【Professional Team】 - Phomemo support team provides lifetime and technical support, including live chat, phone calls, emails even remote desktop operation. If you have any questions or concerns about our Bluetooth shipping label printer, please don't hesitate to contact us. Phone Call: (9:00-17:00 Mon-Fri EST) Email/ Live Chat: (19:30-4:30 Mon-Fri EST)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very good, just tricky to figure out
reviews.reviewText: I wanted to write this review for others who may have issues figuring everything out.to start off i tried downloading the driver onto my laptop, but it just would not download. it kept saying failed. it let me download the regular application but i wasn’t sure how to create labels on it.after a few hours i figured i would just do it on my phone. here’s exactly what i did and how i finally printed a label and am ready to ship a package.1. download the labelife phone app2. make sure your printer is on3. open the app and connect the bluetooth (button on the top right corner)4. now that it’s connected, choose your choice of postage/where you’ll be printing your label from. i use goshippo and usps and did this part on my laptop.5. fill out all the information to create your label.6. pay for it and save it as a pdf7. go to your email and email the file to yourself8. go to your phone and then to your email and save the pdf to your files app8. open the labelife app and press “Open PDF”9. press import pdf, select files, then select the correct file.10. crop it to your liking (mine automatically did it perfect so i did not have to mess with the sizing)11. print!it took me about 3 hours to figure this all out and it’s actually a lot easier than it seemed lol. id definitely recommend using the phone app over the desktop app.the quality also came out perfectly fine which i was very worried about. i think you can fix the settings for that after selecting your pdf on the app though.anyways super happy with this purchase and hope this review helps!6. pay for it and save as a pdf

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I love it !
reviews.reviewText: * I sell Luxury Press Ons @NailsXLuciaY. *I originally bought this for my shipping labels. I have a small business and spend about $30 on ink per month on my regular printer. This made sense as it paid itself off in 3 months.Set up: super easy, I print from my phone with the Bluetooth feature.Omg when I started experimenting with designing little sticker toppers for my shipment boxes ! I’ve also ordered circle stickers to customize them. To think I’ve been paying to have these customized and printed.I am so excited for the possibilities this will allow me in improving my customer experience.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Love this Printer.
reviews.reviewText: Is use the printer to make labels for curriculum kits. The adaptability to numerous size labels is great. The one down fall is it requires LabelLife App, which has a tendency to freeze/shut down on Mac iOS, then requires restart of app. It is a small pain, but the printer being Bluetooth makes it worth it to me. It allows me to easily switch between my laser printer and this one. Fix the app issues and it would be Amazing!!!!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 9, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome price and great quality
reviews.reviewText: I love how simple it was to put it together and how fast in prints out. I love the color and when printing it all looks great!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 29, 2023
reviews.reviewText: once you figure out how to manipulate this printer and software, you got instant stickers at your hands. Installation was very easy. Had to actually play around with the program to figure it out tho.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Very Janky JUNK Printer
reviews.reviewText: Tried two of these printers... both do the same thing. I was able to get some labels printed on Printer #1 before it started flashing with the red lights constantly. Printer#2 would print the first part of the label and then give me a printer/paper jam error with the label still in the printer! Both printers are JUNK absolute JUNK! After about 4 crinkled, wasted labels you might get one label printed. Not worth the frustration and not worth the money.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fácil de usar
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2023
reviews.reviewText: The description cunfused me. This is for a computer, hardwired. I called, very fast REAL PERSON on the other end. They help quickly. I was able to get the phone app bluetooth one in 2 days!

A lovely little printer that works wonders for small businesses. It is easy to set up, takes up little desk space and saves a lot of time/money for printing shipping labels. Super cute and a must have for any small shop!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 28, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: Compact, quick and useful thermal printer
reviews.reviewText: Thermal printers are excellent for printing off multiple address labels or product identifiers with QR codes, barcodes and any number of icons and writing depending on your requirements.This compact Phomemo printer is very easy to setup, takes minutes to get connected via the Labelife app and you're away creating labels to your hearts content, the quality and resolution of the finished labels is very good, easily readable and no visible blurring or smearing around the edges.You get a few options for connecting via Bluetooth, a USB cable and a Mac adapter all included in the box so it's very versatile depending on your setup. You could easily connect this up to a PC and have it working away tucked in a corner with minimal space taken up or packed up for taking travelling as it takes up minimal space and is quick to setup and get churning out labels and as it's a thermal printer you never need to worry about running out of ink or packing spares cartridges.Overall I find Phomemo a pretty decent brand when it comes to small scale thermal printers and id definitely recommend this model for printing off address/shipping labels.
